org.codethechange.culturemesh.models

Class Place

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codethechange.culturemesh.models.Location
      • org.codethechange.culturemesh.models.Place
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Listable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    City, Country, Region

    public abstract class Place
extends Location
implements Listable, java.io.Serializable
    A Place is a Location with more information. While a Location stores only city, region, and country IDs, Place also stores the areas position (latitude and longitude), population, and feature code. Place is abstract, and some examples of its subclasses are: City, Region, and Country. Created by Drew Gregory on 2/23/18. This is the superclass for cities, regions, and countries.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • NOWHERE

        protected static final java.lang.String NOWHERE
        The NOWHERE constant is used internally by this hierarchy as the name of a location's city, region, or country when that geographic identifier is not specified. For example, Washington D.C. has no state (i.e. region), so its region might be stored as NOWHERE. This should never be used by clients. Instead, creating such places should be done through provided constructors or methods.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • id

        public long id
        The ID to be used by a database to identify this object. It is set using Location.getDatabaseId(). See that method's documentation for more information. Crucially it is NOT guaranteed to be unique.

      • latLng

        public Point latLng
        Latitude and longitude

      • population

        public long population
        The population of the described area. This is for display under the "people" icon when areas are listed.

      • featureCode

        public java.lang.String featureCode
        Feature code, which is a string describing the type of place represented (e.g. a capital, a religiously important area, an abandoned populated area). See http://www.geonames.org/export/codes.html for more examples.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Place

        public Place(long countryId,
             long regionId,
             long cityId,
             Point latLng,
             long population,
             java.lang.String featureCode)
        Initialize instance fields with provided parameters. Also calls Location.Location(long, long, long) with the provided IDs Postcondition: id is initialized using Location.getDatabaseId()
        Parameters:
        countryId - ID of country
        regionId - ID of region
        cityId - ID of city
        latLng - Coordinates (latitude and longitude) of location
        population - Population of location
        featureCode - Feature code of location

      • Place

        public Place(org.json.JSONObject json)
      throws org.json.JSONException
        Initializes ID instance fields using the provided JSON object The following keys must be present and are used to fill the relevant instance fields: latitude, longitude, population, feature_code. In addition, the JSON object is passed to Location.Location(JSONObject). See its documentation for details on its requirements. id is initialized using Location.getDatabaseId(). Precondition: The JSON must be validly formatted, with examples in API
        Parameters:
        json - JSON object to extract initializing information from
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - May be thrown for invalidly formatted JSON object

      • Place

        public Place()
        Empty constructor for database use only. This should never be called by our code.

      • getListableName

        public abstract java.lang.String getListableName()
        Subclasses are required to provide a method to generate a name suitable for display in listings of places, as required to implement Listable. This name should be unambiguous.
        Specified by:
        getListableName in interface Listable
        Overrides:
        getListableName in class Location
        Returns:
        Name of Location suitable for display in UI lists

        Name of location suitable for header bar.
